title: The Art of Boundaries
subtitle: Protect your energy without building walls
description: Learn to set, communicate, and maintain healthy boundaries in all your relationships. This course teaches you to say no without guilt, ask for what you need, and protect your energy while staying connected.

modules.title: Understanding Boundaries
modules.description: What they are, why they matter, and where yours are

modules.title: Why Boundaries Are Hard
modules.description: The internal and external obstacles to healthy limits

modules.title: Setting Boundaries
modules.description: How to identify and communicate your limits

modules.title: Maintaining Boundaries
modules.description: Holding your limits when others push back

whatYouLearn: Identify where your boundaries are weak, rigid, or healthy
Understand why setting boundaries feels difficult
Language and scripts for communicating boundaries clearly
How to handle pushback without backing down
Navigate boundaries in family, work, and intimate relationships
requirements: Willingness to examine your relationship patterns
Openness to discomfort that comes with change

questions.question: What is a boundary in relationship terms?
options: A wall to keep people out
A line that defines where you end and others begin, protecting your wellbeing
A rule you impose on others
A way to control people

questions.question: What's the difference between rigid and porous boundaries?
options: Rigid is healthy, porous is not
Rigid keeps everyone out; porous lets too much in - neither is healthy at extremes
Porous is more flexible therefore better
There is no difference

questions.question: Why do many people struggle to set boundaries?
options: They're weak
Fear of rejection, guilt, or learned patterns from childhood
It's not important
Only selfish people set boundaries

questions.question: What is an effective way to communicate a boundary?
options: Apologize profusely then state your need
State it clearly and directly without over-explaining or defending
Blame the other person for making you set it
Wait for them to read your mind

questions.question: What should you do when someone repeatedly violates a stated boundary?
options: Assume they didn't understand and keep explaining
Enforce consequences you've communicated
Give up on boundaries with that person
Get angry and attack them

questions.question: How can you balance boundaries with connection?
options: You can't - boundaries end relationships
Healthy boundaries actually enable deeper connection by creating safety
Lower your boundaries for people you love
Only have boundaries with strangers
